meanings.definition: One who preempts or takes action before someone else can.
meanings.sent1: The preemptor quickly grabbed the last cookie before anyone else could.
meanings.sent2: The company's preemptor always made decisions before the team could discuss them.
meanings.sent3: The preemptor snatched the best seat in the house, leaving everyone else scrambling for a spot.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp intuition acted as a preemptor, always predicting what would happen next.
meanings.sent5: The preemptor's swift actions were like a superhero, always one step ahead of the game.

meanings.definition: Something that preempts or takes precedence over something else.
meanings.sent1: The new policy served as a preemptor, changing the way things were done.
meanings.sent2: The preemptor in the contract stated that the seller had the right to cancel the deal.
meanings.sent3: The preemptor in the game allowed the player to skip ahead to the final level.
meanings.sent4: The preemptor in the meeting agenda ensured that the most important topics were discussed first.
meanings.sent5: The preemptor of the day was the unexpected arrival of a VIP guest, shifting everyone's focus.
